abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project's objectives are to assist the Government to
            lay the foundation for renewed economic growth, maintain
            macroeconomic stabilization over the medium-term, and
            provide an adequate level of public services during the
            fiscal transition. The project consists of five components.
            First, the "natural" monopolies reform component
            will focus on improving pricing; reducing arrears and
            strengthening payment discipline; strengthening regulation;
            and demonopolizing sectors. Second, the private sector
            development component will revitalize the enterprise
            privatization program; establish institutions and policies
            that promote competition; create functioning markets for
            urban land and real estate; and further develop capital
            markets. Third, the fiscal management component will improve
            the tax structure and tax administration; strengthen budget
            management; rationalize government spending; and restructure
            intergovernmental fiscal relations. Fourth, the banking
            reform component will focus on problem banks and deposit
            protection; strengthen prudential regulations and
            supervision; and improve the money markets and payment
            systems. Fifth, the trade policy reform component will
            maintain a liberalized trade regime; harmonize standards
            with international practice; expand production sharing
            agreements; implement a market-based system for oil
            transport; and phase out the oil export of state need program.
